trap.title: Map indexing
trap.intro: Does this compile? Do you get a runtime panic? Do you get a value printed?
trap.discussion:
Map indexing with non-existent index doesn't panic, it yields the zero value of the value type.
Use the two variables assignment v, ok := m["four"] to check if requested index was actually in the map or not. It is called the "comma ok" idiom.
Reference: http://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html#maps
